definition: to correct/to rectify/to redress/strong/brave/to pretend/to feign/affectation
healthy/to invigorate/to strengthen/to be good at/to be strong in

sentences.english: Being bright and brave, the members of the women's volleyball team are passing by the rostrum, walking in vigorous strides.
sentences.chinese: 女排队员们英姿飒爽，正迈着矫健的步伐通过主席台。

sentences.english: You can find great bods everywhere along the beach.
sentences.chinese: 你可以沿海滩到处发现身材矫健的人。

sentences.english: Wead like to recommend our new home heingternativeh monitor.
sentences.chinese: 我们想保举我们新的家庭矫健监测器。

sentences.english: If the old heart, can only take robust steps in their own painted on his cell.
sentences.chinese: 心若老，矫健的步伐也只能走在自己画就的牢房内。

sentences.english: Tashi was brave and strong like an eagle, and Drolma was beautiful and sweet like the Moon.
sentences.chinese: 扎西像雄鹰一样勇敢矫健，卓玛像月亮一样美丽温柔。

sentences.english: His son has grown up into a sturdy hardworking young man.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子已发展为一个矫健勤劳的小伙子。

sentences.english: Two clay-sculptured dragons spiralling up the columns seem to fly up with the head high.
sentences.chinese: 两条盘柱泥塑蟠龙，生动矫健，似欲昂首腾飞。

sentences.english: Your vigorous body, like a meteor, echoing across the silent dawn.
sentences.chinese: 你矫健的身躯，像一颗流星，划过寂静的黎明。

definition: to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
as lithe as a swallow (of athlete or beautiful girl)
